page.title: 14Traffic, Local Concern
page.content: For many years Marson Moretaine has suffered a heavy increase in road traffic.This has risen considerably since the opening of the M1 motorway.East from the motorway are routes to Bedford and East Anglia and the east coast ports of Harwich and Felixstowe. The inhabitants have pressed for many years for a diversion around their village.The County Council has decided to build a By-Pass around the northern side of the village,scheduled to start January 1986.This choice of route is questioned by the locals who would see a southern route as having less divisive impact on the community than the northern route which will sever Upper and Lower Shelton from Marston and bisect Moat Farm necessitating farm machinery to use the road through the village.
